name: v1.5.1
body:
## Summary

This is a first non-alpha release of Asciidoctor EPUB3, mainly because someone got tired of typing "alpha" everywhere. What does it mean for you? Well, most importantly, you no longer need to pass `--pre`  to RubyGems when installing Asciidoctor EPUB3. And that's basically all. We did, are, and will continue to try to keep backward compatibility so documents will still produce adequate EPUB/MOBI files.

Possibly even more exciting feature of this release is that Kindlegen is back! Even though Amazon dropped Kindlegen from its webservers, what was put on the Internets stays there forever. Thanks to The Wayback Machine that remembers (almost) everything, we can use it to download Kindlegen binaries.

Now, a fly in the ointment: Asciidoctor EPUB3 no longer supports Ruby 2.3. It got EOL back in March of 2018 and we continued to support it as long as we could. Today, several of Asciidoctor EPUB3 dependencies already dropped Ruby 2.3 and complexity of its further support is too high for current Asciidoctor EPUB3 development team. Hopefully, three years was enough for everyone to update to newer Ruby!

And please, don't ask what has happened to v1.5.0.

## Distribution

- [RubyGem (asciidoctor-epub3)](https://rubygems.org/gems/asciidoctor-epub3)

## Changelog

* update Font Awesome Solid to 5.15.1
* use CSS for image size scaling instead of `width` attribute (#382)
* use pygments.rb 2.0.0 in CI
* add support for `:back-cover-image:` document attribute (#396)
* reenable Kindlegen support (#363)
* drop support for Ruby 2.3

## Release meta

Released on: 2021-04-29
Released by: @slonopotamus

Logs: [resolved issues](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/issues?q=milestone%3Av1.5.1) | [full diff](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/compare/v1.5.0.alpha.19...v1.5.1)

body:
## Summary

This release is a combination of a few but very annoying bugs fixed and a couple of new features. A single regression that was discovered in previous release was fixed: `<<anchor,link text>>` renders as `link text` again. Syntax highligting support was extended, it is now possible to use both Rouge and CodeRay. Section numbering and captions are now supported, so chapters and appendices are titled properly. Last, but not least, CSS was adjusted to prevent crash on Sony Reader family.

* add xref ids to paragraphs (#317)

* pygments.rb is no longer auto-activated
* add series metadata (#307)
* fix Sony Reader crash (#152)

name: v1.5.0 Alpha 14
body: ## Summary This release starts a new era of Asciidoctor EPUB3. Documents are no longer required to use spine+chapter files structure in order to be properly converted. You're free to organize your document whatever you like even as a single file. Ebook chapters are now determined by document sections. Refer to [Book Parts and Chapters](https://asciidoctor.org/docs/user-manual/#book-parts-and-chapters) section of Asciidoctor manual. You're not required to set `doctype` attribute to `book` anymore. With default doctype (`article`) document will be converted to a single-chapter ebook file. Another notable change is xref syntax. Standard `<>` and `<>` xrefs are now supported, both within and between book chapters. Note that minimal Asciidoctor version has changed to 1.5.6. We do understand that due to amount of changes some bugs could have passed our growing but still someone small test suite, so don't hesitate to [report any issues you encounter](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/issues). ## Distribution - [RubyGem (asciidoctor-epub3)](https://rubygems.org/gems/asciidoctor-epub3) ## Changelog * support conversion of article documents to a single-chapter file * stop requiring specific include file scheme (#47) * support special chapters like bibliography (#205) * `basedir` now points to main document directory when processing chapter files (#190) * fix image and listing numbers being reset in each chapter (#178) * fix xref resolving between sub-includes of chapter files (#166) * add support for contentless include files (#151) * drop nonstandard `<>` xref syntax and instead support vanilla `<>` or `<>` syntax (#136) * properly include bibliography generated by asciidoctor-bibtex (#206) * require Asciidoctor 1.5.6+ * add support for book preamble (#303) * add basic support for multi-part books (#304) * do not include current date if `:reproducible:` attribute is set (#203) * respect `SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH` environment variable for reproducible builds * fix invalid markup produced for tables with footer (#295) * add support for image width/height attributes (#183) * log KindleGen warnings with WARNING log level (#291) * convert stem blocks to `$stem_text` (#10) * use imagedir from an image's context during packaging (#282) * fix images in tables not included in epub archive (#169) * search for `front-matter.html` in document dir instead of CWD (#300) * fix inline images not being included in epub archive (#30) * add support for Font Awesome Solid 5.12.0 (#155) * fix inline anchors missing their ids (#201) * support multiple front-matter files via `epub3-frontmatterdir` attribute * add support for multiple authors in book metadata ## Release meta Released on: 2020-02-29 Released by: @slonopotamus Logs: [resolved issues](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/issues?q=milestone%3Av1.5.0.alpha.14) | [full diff](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/compare/v1.5.0.alpha.13...v1.5.0.alpha.14)

name: v1.5.0 Alpha 11
body:
## Summary

Have you ever encountered `undefined method 'to_ios'` error when used Asciidoctor EPUB3? Forget about it, now Asciidoctor EPUB3 reports why it doesn't like your document instead.

Ever wanted to abort your build process if there are errors in your EPUB file? It is now possible! Just run Asciidoctor EPUB3 with standard Asciidoctor (>= 1.5.7) logging options like `--failure-level ERROR` and it will return non-zero exit code if encounters any errors.

Gradle/Maven users have suffered for several years on Windows, unsuccessfully trying to specify `KINDLEGEN` environment variable, but still getting `ENOENT` errors when converting to KF8/Mobi. Those times are now ended. Asciidoctor EPUB3 not only will properly invoke `kindlegen` from Ruby gem, it will also respect your `KINDLEGEN` environment variable  in case you want to specify where your custom `kindlegen` executable is located.

Supported versions haven't changed: Ruby >= 2.3, Asciidoctor >= 1.5.3.

Consult the CHANGELOG to find the complete list of changes.

## Distribution

- [RubyGem (asciidoctor-epub3)](https://rubygems.org/gems/asciidoctor-epub3)

## Changelog

* drop unused dependencies: thread_safe, concurrent-ruby (#234)
* add support for Unicode characters in chapter IDs (#217)
* fix sample book to be a valid book (#196)
* don't insert quotation marks around quotes (#129)
* require at least Asciidoctor 1.5.3 (#245)
* remove Namo Reader font-icon quirk that produced invalid markup (#192)
* fix the (in)famous `undefined method `to_ios'` when given a document that doesn't follow asciidoctor-epub3 rules (#7)
* route messages through the logger (#176)
* update EPUBCheck to 4.2.2.0 (#240)
* handle invalid `revdate` gracefully (#14)
* do not post-process EPUBCHECK env var, but use it as-is (#258)
* disable Pygments on JRuby to prevent hanging (#253)
* fix ENOENT error when trying to run EPUBcheck on JRuby on Windows (#256)
* fix ENOENT error when running kindlegen on JRuby on Windows (#154)
* set up CI for JRuby on Windows (#254)

## Release meta

Released on: 2020-01-26
Released by: @slonopotamus

Logs: [resolved issues](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/issues?q=milestone%3Av1.5.0.alpha.11) | [full diff](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/compare/v1.5.0.alpha.10...v1.5.0.alpha.11)

name: v1.5.0 Alpha 10
body:
## Summary

The community discovered a rather large problem when using Asciidoctor EPUB3 with Asciidoctor 2 in that deep xrefs between chapters were not being resolved. So we're turning around a small release to address that problem. The version of gepub and kindlegen have also been updated, and inline JavaScript is wrapped in CDATA to escape any HTML-mangling characters. Note that the minimum version of Ruby for this project is now Ruby 2.3 (2.4 on Windows).

We're excited to share that as of this release, the project *finally* has a test suite. All changes will be tested from this point forward and we'll gradually write tests to cover existing behavior.

Finally, I'm thrilled to announce that @slonopotamus will take over as the maintainer of this project and give it a future. If the project is vital to you, please give whatever support you can to help share the load.

Consult the CHANGELOG to find the complete list of changes.

## Distribution

- [RubyGem (asciidoctor-epub3)](https://rubygems.org/gems/asciidoctor-epub3)

## Changelog

* fix deep xrefs between chapters when using Asciidoctor 2 (#210)
* switch from epubcheck to epubcheck-ruby (#224)
* set up a test suite (#11)
* set up rubocop to enforce a consistent code style (#223)
* use GitHub Actions for CI and release process (#218)
* fix JS causing malformed XML that prevented footnotes from being displayed in Calibre (#207)
* fix installing on Windows (#213, #216)
* upgrade pygments.rb to 1.2.1 (#216)
* gepub dependency is no longer locked to 1.0.2 and will use latest 1.0.x version
* fix `-a ebook-validate` not working on Windows (#232)

## Release meta

Released on: 2020-01-20
Released by: @slonopotamus with @mojavelinux

Logs: [resolved issues](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/issues?q=milestone%3Av1.5.0.alpha.10) | [full diff](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/compare/v1.5.0.alpha.9...v1.5.0.alpha.10)

## Credits

A very special thanks to all the **awesome** [supporters of the Asciidoctor OpenCollective campaign](https://opencollective.com/asciidoctor) who provided critical funding for the development of this release as well as ongoing development of the project.

* retain ID of admonition block (#146)

## Credits

Thanks to everyone else who asked questions, submitted issues, and contributed patches during this release cycle.

A big thanks to @cexbrayat, @clacote, @PrimaryFeather, who helped get the font color right on the Kindle Paperwhite.

A very special thanks to all the **awesome** [supporters of the Asciidoctor Salt campaign](https://salt.bountysource.com/teams/asciidoctor/supporters) who provided critical funding for the development of this release as well as ongoing development of the project.

name: v1.5.0 Alpha 7
body:
This release eliminates numerous limitations for both authors and readers. Authors can now create intelligent cross references between chapters, making it easier for readers to navigate the document. Readers also benefit from a full TOC (as controlled by the `toclevels` attribute). The styles have been updated to be more generally applicable for books and also compatible with modern ereaders. Along the way, many other smaller bugs have been fixed which you can find listed in the Changelog below.

## Distribution

- [RubyGem (asciidoctor-epub3)](https://rubygems.org/gems/asciidoctor-epub3)

## Changelog

* generate TOC levels in navigation document based on toclevels attribute (#90)
* automatically resolve title of reference between documents (#87)
* fix xref between chapter files (#27)
* don't include byline in chapter header if the value of the publication-type attribute is book (#86)
* don't include avatars if value of publication-type attribute is book (#53)
* make a stronger statement in the README about the dangers of the “Send to Kindle” tool
* add ebook-compress flag to enable huffdic compression in kindlegen
* implement embedded to handle AsciiDoc table cell content (#69)
* go into more depth about how to structure the document in README (#45)
* explain how to adjust section level of chapters if they use level-2 headings
* don't add content image to archive more than once (#76)
* warn when xref cannot be resolved and text is provided (#103)
* built-in avatar location should respect imagesdir (#2)
* change admonition icons (#72) (@PrimaryFeather)
* fix broken refs in bibliography (#19)
* remove text justification hack (#92)
* reset `@page` for CSS3-capable readers
* detect Calibre, set class attribute on body to calibre-desktop, add page margins
* force preformatted text to wrap in Gitden
* add svg property to front matter only if reference to SVG is detected
* switch from word-wrap to standard overflow-wrap property in stylesheet
* loosen letter spacing in quote attribute context
* adjust font size and margins on Gitden; force margins to be set
* document in README that using vw units causes Aldiko to crash
* drop trailing semi-colon in value of inline style attributes
* use standard format (from core) for warning and error messages
* update terminology in README; use ebook instead of e-book; refer to application as ereader
* allow front-cover-image to be specified using block image macro (#3)
* clean auto-generated file names for chapters (#46)
* register chapter ID in references
* only wrap open block content in div if id or role is defined (@rvolz)
* link to EPUB 3.1 spec from README
* set ebook-format-kf8 attribute when ebook-format is specified as mobi
* document the front-cover-image attribute properly
* update adb-push-book script to honor file extension if specified
* document limitations of applying page-break-* property on Kindle
* document that Asciidoctor is added as creator if creator attribute is not specified (#68)
* group optional gems in the :optional group; remove from gemspec
* upgrade kindlegen gem to 3.0.3
* upgrade Pygments to 1.1.1 and allow JRuby to install it
* document that Pygments bw style is used by default
* honor explicit table width even when autowidth option is set
* use method_defined? instead of respond_to? to check if method is already defined
* fix README typo, strong tag misspelled (@neontapir)
* fix name of bundler gem; add NOKOGIRI_USE_SYSTEM_LIBRARIES to install command
* state in README that the spine document must only have include directives as content

## Release meta

Released on: 2017-04-18
Released by: @mojavelinux

Logs: [resolved issues](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/issues?q=milestone%3Av1.5.0.alpha.7) | [full diff](https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-epub3/compare/v1.5.0.alpha.6...v1.5.0.alpha.7)

## Credits

Thanks to everyone else who asked questions, submitted issues, and contributed patches during this release cycle.

A huge thanks to @thjanssen for testing Asciidoctor EPUB3, providing feedback, and reporting issues while working on his new [Hibernate Tips Book](http://www.thoughts-on-java.org/bookwriting/). Also thanks to @PrimaryFeather for providing design guidance for the selection of the new admonition icons and colors. Additional thanks goes to @mraible, @ysb33r, @jnizet and @cexbrayat of Ninja Squad, and @wintermeyer, the authors who helped identify improvements for the converter and advocated for Asciidoctor EPUB3 during this release. It's the dedicated self-publishing authors, especially, who help make Asciidoctor EPUB3 what it is today and keep the project moving forward. 

A very special thanks to all the **awesome** [supporters of the Asciidoctor Salt campaign](https://salt.bountysource.com/teams/asciidoctor/supporters) who provided critical funding for the development of this release as well as ongoing development of the project.

name: v1.5.0 Alpha 6
body:
A significant bug fix release with critical improvements to the CSS that enable publisher styles in more places, prevents crashes in Kindle for Mac, works around the KDP CSS guillotine, smaller mobi file size and more thorough and accurate documentation.

## Distribution
- [RubyGem (asciidoctor-epub3)](https://rubygems.org/gems/asciidoctor-epub3)

## Changelog
- disable text-rendering: optimizeLegibility on Kindle devices (#58)
- proxy CSS in KF8 format to work around KDP removing font-related CSS rules
- don't append source when generating mobi file
- disable -webkit-hyphens to prevent Kindle for Mac from crashing (#26)
- don't explicitly enable hyphenation
- disable hyphens in preformatted text
- don't fail if source block is empty
- hide style element in body from Aldiko
- enable Original (Publisher) font option in iBooks client
- preserve heading & monospaced fonts in Kindle Paperwhite/Voyage
- force left justification in listings (fix for Namo)
- fix documentation regarding uuid attribute (@chkal)
- add note that currently images must be placed in a directory called images (@chkal)
- fix file type of avatar image in docs (@chkal)
- document how to install the pre-release gem (#38)
- use built-in font names for mobi7 (#56)
- document the epub3-stylesdir attribute
- prevent ellipsis from being used in inline code
- don't include scoped icon CSS in KF8 format
- remove link color hack for Gitden since its already covered
- override heading and monospace fonts for non-Kindle epub3 readers
- wrap simple dd content in span to allow font to be controlled in iBooks
- enforce use of monospace font for preformatted elements
- upgrade kindlegen
- don't allow UI button to wrap
- remove amzn-mobi from media query in CSS3-only file
- use CSS property word-wrap instead of word-break
- remove charset declaration from CSS
- switch samples to modern AsciiDoc syntax

## Release meta

Released on: 2016-01-05
Released by: @mojavelinux
